description: Needs dark backgrounds for feeds and the browser tab, and also a way to default to a reader mode for websites. best wishes

Every time I launch it and fetch feeds, it forgets which articles I've read and marks them all as unread, despite all settings being correct that are related.

Also, every time I shut down the PC, it always greets me the next time with "Akregator did not shut down correctly". It's quite annoying to have to close the app manually before I shut down every time, as I allow my computer to handle the closing of all my apps, which works fine, except for this one, which complains about it every single time I launch the app.

If these two things were fixed, it would be great, and I'd love to use it as I prefer to stay in the KDE ecosystem, but in its current state it's quite annoying to the user.
summary: UNmarks read and "did not shut down correctly"

description: Liferea crashes. Akregator does not. It memory leaks, but only on Debian, which I don't use.

description: It is simple and works as it should be.

summary: Doesnt show all feeds when there are more than ~100

description: 5 Bintang dulu ya wkwkwk

After trying every RSS software around, I settled for Akregrator.
It is solid rock.

As an RSS feed reader it's a solid piece of software, but imo it falls a bit short on UI polish. The most glaring of which is the white reading pane while running a dark theme, which isn't very kind to my eyes.

Second, I wish the list of articles could be shown in a bit less compact way. As it stands, the list feels cramped. The font is small, making it hard to read and look at without it feeling somewhat busy. There are many other RSS readers out there which have this more "cozy" size of the article list UI. Would like to be able to toggle a "compact" and "cozy" size.
Also, the "Add Feed" button ought to be on the toolbar by default
summary: UI leaves some to be desired

description: All time its opened it shows same RSS..
summary: Same RSS all time its opened

description: Great app, Simple and Efficient

Disappointing after reading positive reviews. I experienced the opposite. The main issue and reason why I deleted the app is because if you ask the software to delete a folder or feed it will not. This first happened when I was trying to delete some of the default folders like Spanish Feeds. No matter how many times you select and tell the folder to delete itself, it will just ignore your request. In comparison, I also tried Liferea. That software seems to work perfectly.

it's a nice viewer. I tend to open URLs directly which is nice, and it's got adblocker.
Going back is a tricky operation.
Very often it crashes, so i have to restore the view in Kontact.

Just like Jamie, I can't delete, rename or do anything with the Spanish News folder. I have deleted the line specifying it's existence in all the instances of it appearing in the ./local/share/akregator/ folder. Still appears, once I start up the application. Deleting any spanish using names in the archive folder doesn't help. That is about as far I wanted to wrestle with that issue, having spend something like 30 minutes just trying to fix it.

Better/Worse yet, is that I can rename other folders, folders that were also included by default, except for this one.
summary: Broken- Can't delete Spanish Feeds Folder

description: Does not work on pine phone with manjaro

it's impossible to remove the software...
works neat and clean!
would really love to be able to read just the written content
Seemingly solid except that I get no sound when trying to play anything using Akregator's internal browser, and that's a deal breaker.
